intro: Dithyrea wislizeni, commonly known as the wislizeni dittany, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
